Class BackTrackLaby

java.lang.Object
BackTrackLaby
public class BackTrackLaby extends Object
This class contains all the variables, fields, and methods needed in order to backtrack through a maze with brute force. It also prints all the moves of the solution, allowing users to take a closer look at how it works. It also prints to the user if the maze was solved or not solved by the program.

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Main method which tells you if the code was able to solve the current maze being referenced.
      Parameters:
      Takes - in two args for the row and column of the @Labyrinth ( @labRow and @labCol ).

    • solve

      public int[][] solve​(Labyrinth l)
      This method calls the recursive method ( @findSafeMove ) and is where all the moves of the correct solution are accounted for and converted into another 2-D array that it returns.
      Parameters:
      Takes - in a @Labyrinth object ( @l )
      Returns:
      Returns a 2-D int array which is then taken by the @solves method of @Labyrinth.

    • isASafeMove

      public boolean isASafeMove​(int row, int col, int[] x, Labyrinth l)
      Method which checks if a move is safe or not. Uses methods from
      Parameters:
      Takes - in four parameters: two ints ( @row and @col ), a 1-D int array ( @x ), and a @Labyrinth object ( @l ).
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value (safe or not safe).

    • findSafeMove

      public void findSafeMove​(int row, int col, Labyrinth l)
      Method containing the recursive/backtracking algorithm. It will end once the last tile of the Labyrinth has been visited ( @alreadyBeenHere ).
      Parameters:
      Takes - in three parameters: two ints ( @row and @col ), and a @Labyrinth object ( @l ).
